publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4336 Mr Jamie McGrigor: J K Galbraith—That the Parliament notes with sadness the death of the great Scots-Canadian economist, Professor J K Galbraith, Emeritus Professor of Economics at the University of Harvard, United States of America, former ambassador to India in John F Kennedy’s administration, prolific writer of varied texts, including The Non-Potable Scotch, a recollection of boyhood in a Scottish community in Ontario, and hails the full and interesting life of this great man whose roots and ancestry lay in Crinan in Argyll.
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Stewart Stevenson*

S2M-4336 Mr Jamie McGrigor: J K Galbraith—That the Parliament notes with sadness the death of the great Scots-Canadian economist, Professor J K Galbraith, Emeritus Professor of Economics at the University of Harvard, United States of America, former ambassador to India in John F Kennedy’s administration, prolific writer of varied texts, including The Non-Potable Scotch, a recollection of boyhood in a Scottish community in Ontario, and hails the full and interesting life of this great man whose roots and ancestry lay in Crinan in Argyll. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Christine Grahame*
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Mr Ted Brocklebank*
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-4336 J K Galbraith (lodged on 3 May 2006) Ms Maureen Watt*
